23  package com.dd.plist;
24  
25  import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
26  import java.io.File;
27  import java.io.FileInputStream;
28  import java.io.IOException;
29  import java.io.InputStream;
30  import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException;
31  import java.nio.CharBuffer;
32  import java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException;
33  import java.nio.charset.Charset;
34  import java.nio.charset.CharsetEncoder;
35  import java.text.ParseException;
36  import java.text.StringCharacterIterator;
37  import java.util.LinkedList;
38  import java.util.List;
39  
40  /**
41   * Parser for ASCII property lists. Supports Apple OS X/iOS and GnuStep/NeXTSTEP format.
42   * This parser is based on the recursive descent paradigm, but the underlying grammar
43   * is not explicitely defined.
44   * <p/>
45   * Resources on ASCII property list format:
46   * <ul>
47   * <li><a href="https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/PropertyLists/OldStylePlists/OldStylePLists.html>
48   * Property List Programming Guide - Old-Style ASCII Property Lists
49   * </a></li>
50   * <li><a href="http://www.gnustep.org/resources/documentation/Developer/Base/Reference/NSPropertyList.html">
51   * GnuStep - NSPropertyListSerialization class documentation
52   * </a></li>
53   * </ul>
54   *
55   * @author Daniel Dreibrodt
56   */
57  public class ASCIIPropertyListParser {
58  
59      /**
60       * Parses an ASCII property list file.
61       *
62       * @param f The ASCII property list file.
63       * @return The root object of the property list. This is usally a NSDictionary but can also be a NSArray.
64       * @throws Exception When an error occurs during parsing.
65       */
66      public static NSObject parse(File f) throws IOException, ParseException {
67          return parse(new FileInputStream(f));
68      }
69  
70      /**
71       * Parses an ASCII property list from an input stream.
72       *
73       * @param in The input stream that points to the property list's data.
74       * @return The root object of the property list. This is usally a NSDictionary but can also be a NSArray.
75       * @throws Exception When an error occurs during parsing.
76       */
77      public static NSObject parse(InputStream in) throws ParseException, IOException {
78          byte[] buf = PropertyListParser.readAll(in);
79          in.close();
80          return parse(buf);
81      }
82  
83      /**
84       * Parses an ASCII property list from a byte array.
85       *
86       * @param bytes The ASCII property list data.
87       * @return The root object of the property list. This is usally a NSDictionary but can also be a NSArray.
88       * @throws Exception When an error occurs during parsing.
89       */
90      public static NSObject parse(byte[] bytes) throws ParseException {
91          ASCIIPropertyListParser parser = new ASCIIPropertyListParser(bytes);
92          return parser.parse();
93      }
94  
95      public static final char WHITESPACE_SPACE = ' ';
96      public static final char WHITESPACE_TAB = '\t';
97      public static final char WHITESPACE_NEWLINE = '\n';
98      public static final char WHITESPACE_CARRIAGE_RETURN = '\r';
99  
100     public static final char ARRAY_BEGIN_TOKEN = '(';
101     public static final char ARRAY_END_TOKEN = ')';
102     public static final char ARRAY_ITEM_DELIMITER_TOKEN = ',';
103 
104     public static final char DICTIONARY_BEGIN_TOKEN = '{';
105     public static final char DICTIONARY_END_TOKEN = '}';
106     public static final char DICTIONARY_ASSIGN_TOKEN = '=';
107     public static final char DICTIONARY_ITEM_DELIMITER_TOKEN = ';';
108 
109     public static final char QUOTEDSTRING_BEGIN_TOKEN = '"';
110     public static final char QUOTEDSTRING_END_TOKEN = '"';
111     public static final char QUOTEDSTRING_ESCAPE_TOKEN = '\\';
112 
113     public static final char DATA_BEGIN_TOKEN = '<';
114     public static final char DATA_END_TOKEN = '>';
115 
116     public static final char DATA_GSOBJECT_BEGIN_TOKEN = '*';
117     public static final char DATA_GSDATE_BEGIN_TOKEN = 'D';
118     public static final char DATA_GSBOOL_BEGIN_TOKEN = 'B';
119     public static final char DATA_GSBOOL_TRUE_TOKEN = 'Y';
120     public static final char DATA_GSBOOL_FALSE_TOKEN = 'N';
121     public static final char DATA_GSINT_BEGIN_TOKEN = 'I';
122     public static final char DATA_GSREAL_BEGIN_TOKEN = 'R';
123 
124     public static final char DATE_DATE_FIELD_DELIMITER = '-';
125     public static final char DATE_TIME_FIELD_DELIMITER = ':';
126     public static final char DATE_GS_DATE_TIME_DELIMITER = ' ';
127     public static final char DATE_APPLE_DATE_TIME_DELIMITER = 'T';
128     public static final char DATE_APPLE_END_TOKEN = 'Z';
129 
130     public static final char COMMENT_BEGIN_TOKEN = '/';
131     public static final char MULTILINE_COMMENT_SECOND_TOKEN = '*';
132     public static final char SINGLELINE_COMMENT_SECOND_TOKEN = '/';
133     public static final char MULTILINE_COMMENT_END_TOKEN = '/';
134 
135     /**
136      * Property list source data
137      */
138     private byte[] data;
139     /**
140      * Current parsing index
141      */
142     private int index;
143 
144     /**
145      * Only allow subclasses to change instantiation.
146      */
147     protected ASCIIPropertyListParser() {
148 
149     }
150 
151     /**
152      * Creates a new parser for the given property list content.
153      *
154      * @param propertyListContent The content of the property list that is to be parsed.
155      */
156     private ASCIIPropertyListParser(byte[] propertyListContent) {
157         data = propertyListContent;
158     }
159 
160     /**
161      * Checks whether the given sequence of symbols can be accepted.
162      *
163      * @param sequence The sequence of tokens to look for.
164      * @return Whether the given tokens occur at the current parsing position.
165      */
166     private boolean acceptSequence(char... sequence) {
167         for (int i = 0; i < sequence.length; i++) {
168             if (data[index + i] != sequence[i])
169                 return false;
170         }
171         return true;
172     }
173 
174     /**
175      * Checks whether the given symbols can be accepted, that is, if one
176      * of the given symbols is found at the current parsing position.
177      *
178      * @param acceptableSymbols The symbols to check.
179      * @return Whether one of the symbols can be accepted or not.
180      */
181     private boolean accept(char... acceptableSymbols) {
182         boolean symbolPresent = false;
183         for (char c : acceptableSymbols) {
184             if (data[index] == c)
185                 symbolPresent = true;
186         }
187         return symbolPresent;
188     }
189 
190     /**
191      * Checks whether the given symbol can be accepted, that is, if
192      * the given symbols is found at the current parsing position.
193      *
194      * @param acceptableSymbol The symbol to check.
195      * @return Whether the symbol can be accepted or not.
196      */
197     private boolean accept(char acceptableSymbol) {
198         return data[index] == acceptableSymbol;
199     }
200 
201     /**
202      * Expects the input to have one of the given symbols at the current parsing position.
203      *
204      * @param expectedSymbols The expected symbols.
205      * @throws ParseException If none of the expected symbols could be found.
206      */
207     private void expect(char... expectedSymbols) throws ParseException {
208         if (!accept(expectedSymbols)) {
209             String excString = "Expected '" + expectedSymbols[0] + "'";
210             for (int i = 1; i < expectedSymbols.length; i++) {
211                 excString += " or '" + expectedSymbols[i] + "'";
212             }
213             excString += " but found '" + (char) data[index] + "'";
214             throw new ParseException(excString, index);
215         }
216     }
217 
218     /**
219      * Expects the input to have the given symbol at the current parsing position.
220      *
221      * @param expectedSymbol The expected symbol.
222      * @throws ParseException If the expected symbol could be found.
223      */
224     private void expect(char expectedSymbol) throws ParseException {
225         if (!accept(expectedSymbol))
226             throw new ParseException("Expected '" + expectedSymbol + "' but found '" + (char) data[index] + "'", index);
227     }
228 
229     /**
230      * Reads an expected symbol.
231      *
232      * @param symbol The symbol to read.
233      * @throws ParseException If the expected symbol could not be read.
234      */
235     private void read(char symbol) throws ParseException {
236         expect(symbol);
237         index++;
238     }
239 
240     /**
241      * Skips the current symbol.
242      */
243     private void skip() {
244         index++;
245     }
246 
247     /**
248      * Skips several symbols
249      *
250      * @param numSymbols The amount of symbols to skip.
251      */
252     private void skip(int numSymbols) {
253         index += numSymbols;
254     }
255 
256     /**
257      * Skips all whitespaces and comments from the current parsing position onward.
258      */
259     private void skipWhitespacesAndComments() {
260         boolean commentSkipped;
261         do {
262             commentSkipped = false;
263 
264             //Skip whitespaces
265             while (accept(WHITESPACE_CARRIAGE_RETURN, WHITESPACE_NEWLINE, WHITESPACE_SPACE, WHITESPACE_TAB)) {
266                 skip();
267             }
268 
269             //Skip single line comments "//..."
270             if (acceptSequence(COMMENT_BEGIN_TOKEN, SINGLELINE_COMMENT_SECOND_TOKEN)) {
271                 skip(2);
272                 readInputUntil(WHITESPACE_CARRIAGE_RETURN, WHITESPACE_NEWLINE);
273                 commentSkipped = true;
274             }
275             //Skip multi line comments "/* ... */"
276             else if (acceptSequence(COMMENT_BEGIN_TOKEN, MULTILINE_COMMENT_SECOND_TOKEN)) {
277                 skip(2);
278                 while (true) {
279                     if (acceptSequence(MULTILINE_COMMENT_SECOND_TOKEN, MULTILINE_COMMENT_END_TOKEN)) {
280                         skip(2);
281                         break;
282                     }
283                     skip();
284                 }
285                 commentSkipped = true;
286             }
287         }
288         while (commentSkipped); //if a comment was skipped more whitespace or another comment can follow, so skip again
289     }
290 
291     private String toUtf8String(ByteArrayOutputStream stream) {
292         try {
293             return stream.toString("UTF-8");
294         } catch (UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
295             throw new RuntimeException(e);
296         }
297     }
298 
299     /**
300      * Reads input until one of the given symbols is found.
301      *
302      * @param symbols The symbols that can occur after the string to read.
303      * @return The input until one the given symbols.
304      */
305     private String readInputUntil(char... symbols) {
306         ByteArrayOutputStream stringBytes = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
307         while (!accept(symbols)) {
308             stringBytes.write(data[index]);
309             skip();
310         }
311         return toUtf8String(stringBytes);
312     }
313 
314     /**
315      * Reads input until the given symbol is found.
316      *
317      * @param symbol The symbol that can occur after the string to read.
318      * @return The input until the given symbol.
319      */
320     private String readInputUntil(char symbol) {
321         ByteArrayOutputStream stringBytes = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
322         while (!accept(symbol)) {
323             stringBytes.write(data[index]);
324             skip();
325         }
326         return toUtf8String(stringBytes);
327     }
328 
329     /**
330      * Parses the property list from the beginning and returns the root object
331      * of the property list.
332      *
333      * @return The root object of the property list. This can either be a NSDictionary or a NSArray.
334      * @throws ParseException When an error occured during parsing
335      */
336     public NSObject parse() throws ParseException {
337         index = 0;
338         skipWhitespacesAndComments();
339         expect(DICTIONARY_BEGIN_TOKEN, ARRAY_BEGIN_TOKEN, COMMENT_BEGIN_TOKEN);
340         try {
341             return parseObject();
342         } catch (ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException ex) {
343             throw new ParseException("Reached end of input unexpectedly.", index);
344         }
345     }
346 
347     /**
348      * Parses the NSObject found at the current position in the property list
349      * data stream.
350      *
351      * @return The parsed NSObject.
352      * @see ASCIIPropertyListParser#index
353      */
354     private NSObject parseObject() throws ParseException {
355         switch (data[index]) {
356             case ARRAY_BEGIN_TOKEN: {
357                 return parseArray();
358             }
359             case DICTIONARY_BEGIN_TOKEN: {
360                 return parseDictionary();
361             }
362             case DATA_BEGIN_TOKEN: {
363                 return parseData();
364             }
365             case QUOTEDSTRING_BEGIN_TOKEN: {
366                 String quotedString = parseQuotedString();
367                 //apple dates are quoted strings of length 20 and after the 4 year digits a dash is found
368                 if (quotedString.length() == 20 && quotedString.charAt(4) == DATE_DATE_FIELD_DELIMITER) {
369                     try {
370                         return new NSDate(quotedString);
371                     } catch (Exception ex) {
372                         //not a date? --> return string
373                         return new NSString(quotedString);
374                     }
375                 } else {
376                     return new NSString(quotedString);
377                 }
378             }
379             default: {
380                 //0-9
381                 if (data[index] > 0x2F && data[index] < 0x3A) {
382                     //could be a date or just a string
383                     return parseDateString();
384                 } else {
385                     //non-numerical -> string or boolean
386                     String parsedString = parseString();
387                     return new NSString(parsedString);
388                 }
389             }
390         }
391     }
392 
393     /**
394      * Parses an array from the current parsing position.
395      * The prerequisite for calling this method is, that an array begin token has been read.
396      *
397      * @return The array found at the parsing position.
398      */
399     private NSArray parseArray() throws ParseException {
400         //Skip begin token
401         skip();
402         skipWhitespacesAndComments();
403         List<NSObject> objects = new LinkedList<NSObject>();
404         while (!accept(ARRAY_END_TOKEN)) {
405             objects.add(parseObject());
406             skipWhitespacesAndComments();
407             if (accept(ARRAY_ITEM_DELIMITER_TOKEN)) {
408                 skip();
409             } else {
410                 break; //must have reached end of array
411             }
412             skipWhitespacesAndComments();
413         }
414         //parse end token
415         read(ARRAY_END_TOKEN);
416         return new NSArray(objects.toArray(new NSObject[objects.size()]));
417     }
418 
419     /**
420      * Parses a dictionary from the current parsing position.
421      * The prerequisite for calling this method is, that a dictionary begin token has been read.
422      *
423      * @return The dictionary found at the parsing position.
424      */
425     private NSDictionary parseDictionary() throws ParseException {
426         //Skip begin token
427         skip();
428         skipWhitespacesAndComments();
429         NSDictionary dict = new NSDictionary();
430         while (!accept(DICTIONARY_END_TOKEN)) {
431             //Parse key
432             String keyString;
433             if (accept(QUOTEDSTRING_BEGIN_TOKEN)) {
434                 keyString = parseQuotedString();
435             } else {
436                 keyString = parseString();
437             }
438             skipWhitespacesAndComments();
439 
440             //Parse assign token
441             read(DICTIONARY_ASSIGN_TOKEN);
442             skipWhitespacesAndComments();
443 
444             NSObject object = parseObject();
445             dict.put(keyString, object);
446             skipWhitespacesAndComments();
447             read(DICTIONARY_ITEM_DELIMITER_TOKEN);
448             skipWhitespacesAndComments();
449         }
450         //skip end token
451         skip();
452         return dict;
453     }
454 
455     /**
456      * Parses a data object from the current parsing position.
457      * This can either be a NSData object or a GnuStep NSNumber or NSDate.
458      * The prerequisite for calling this method is, that a data begin token has been read.
459      *
460      * @return The data object found at the parsing position.
461      */
462     private NSObject parseData() throws ParseException {
463         NSObject obj = null;
464         //Skip begin token
465         skip();
466         if (accept(DATA_GSOBJECT_BEGIN_TOKEN)) {
467             skip();
468             expect(DATA_GSBOOL_BEGIN_TOKEN, DATA_GSDATE_BEGIN_TOKEN, DATA_GSINT_BEGIN_TOKEN, DATA_GSREAL_BEGIN_TOKEN);
469             if (accept(DATA_GSBOOL_BEGIN_TOKEN)) {
470                 //Boolean
471                 skip();
472                 expect(DATA_GSBOOL_TRUE_TOKEN, DATA_GSBOOL_FALSE_TOKEN);
473                 if (accept(DATA_GSBOOL_TRUE_TOKEN)) {
474                     obj = new NSNumber(true);
475                 } else {
476                     obj = new NSNumber(false);
477                 }
478                 //Skip the parsed boolean token
479                 skip();
480             } else if (accept(DATA_GSDATE_BEGIN_TOKEN)) {
481                 //Date
482                 skip();
483                 String dateString = readInputUntil(DATA_END_TOKEN);
484                 obj = new NSDate(dateString);
485             } else if (accept(DATA_GSINT_BEGIN_TOKEN, DATA_GSREAL_BEGIN_TOKEN)) {
486                 //Number
487                 skip();
488                 String numberString = readInputUntil(DATA_END_TOKEN);
489                 obj = new NSNumber(numberString);
490             }
491             //parse data end token
492             read(DATA_END_TOKEN);
493         } else {
494             String dataString = readInputUntil(DATA_END_TOKEN);
495             dataString = dataString.replaceAll("\\s+", "");
496 
497             int numBytes = dataString.length() / 2;
498             byte[] bytes = new byte[numBytes];
499             for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) {
500                 String byteString = dataString.substring(i * 2, i * 2 + 2);
501                 int byteValue = Integer.parseInt(byteString, 16);
502                 bytes[i] = (byte) byteValue;
503             }
504             obj = new NSData(bytes);
505 
506             //skip end token
507             skip();
508         }
509 
510         return obj;
511     }
512 
513     /**
514      * Attempts to parse a plain string as a date if possible.
515      *
516      * @return A NSDate if the string represents such an object. Otherwise a NSString is returned.
517      */
518     private NSObject parseDateString() {
519         String numericalString = parseString();
520         if (numericalString.length() > 4 && numericalString.charAt(4) == DATE_DATE_FIELD_DELIMITER) {
521             try {
522                 return new NSDate(numericalString);
523             } catch(Exception ex) {
524                 //An exception occurs if the string is not a date but just a string
525             }
526         }
527         return new NSString(numericalString);
528     }
529 
530     /**
531      * Parses a plain string from the current parsing position.
532      * The string is made up of all characters to the next whitespace, delimiter token or assignment token.
533      *
534      * @return The string found at the current parsing position.
535      */
536     private String parseString() {
537         return readInputUntil(WHITESPACE_SPACE, WHITESPACE_TAB, WHITESPACE_NEWLINE, WHITESPACE_CARRIAGE_RETURN,
538                 ARRAY_ITEM_DELIMITER_TOKEN, DICTIONARY_ITEM_DELIMITER_TOKEN, DICTIONARY_ASSIGN_TOKEN, ARRAY_END_TOKEN);
539     }
540 
541     /**
542      * Parses a quoted string from the current parsing position.
543      * The prerequisite for calling this method is, that a quoted string begin token has been read.
544      *
545      * @return The quoted string found at the parsing method with all special characters unescaped.
546      * @throws ParseException If an error occured during parsing.
547      */
548     private String parseQuotedString() throws ParseException {
549         //Skip begin token
550         skip();
551         ByteArrayOutputStream quotedString = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
552         boolean unescapedBackslash = true;
553         //Read from opening quotation marks to closing quotation marks and skip escaped quotation marks
554         while (data[index] != QUOTEDSTRING_END_TOKEN || (data[index - 1] == QUOTEDSTRING_ESCAPE_TOKEN && unescapedBackslash)) {
555             quotedString.write(data[index]);
556             if (accept(QUOTEDSTRING_ESCAPE_TOKEN)) {
557                 unescapedBackslash = !(data[index - 1] == QUOTEDSTRING_ESCAPE_TOKEN && unescapedBackslash);
558             }
559             skip();
560         }
561         String unescapedString;
562         try {
563             unescapedString = parseQuotedString(toUtf8String(quotedString));
564         } catch (Exception ex) {
565             throw new ParseException("The quoted string could not be parsed.", index);
566         }
567         //skip end token
568         skip();
569         return unescapedString;
570     }
571 
572     /**
573      * Used to encode the parsed strings
574      */
575     private static CharsetEncoder asciiEncoder;
576 
577     /**
578      * Parses a string according to the format specified for ASCII property lists.
579      * Such strings can contain escape sequences which are unescaped in this method.
580      *
581      * @param s The escaped string according to the ASCII property list format, without leading and trailing quotation marks.
582      * @return The unescaped string in UTF-8 or ASCII format, depending on the contained characters.
583      * @throws Exception If the string could not be properly parsed.
584      */
585     public static synchronized String parseQuotedString(String s) throws UnsupportedEncodingException, CharacterCodingException {
586         StringBuilder parsed = new StringBuilder();
587         StringCharacterIterator iterator = new StringCharacterIterator(s);
588         char c = iterator.current();
589 
590         while (iterator.getIndex() < iterator.getEndIndex()) {
591             switch (c) {
592                 case '\\': { //An escaped sequence is following
593                     parsed.append(parseEscapedSequence(iterator));
594                     break;
595                 }
596                 default: {
597                     parsed.append(c);
598                     break;
599                 }
600             }
601             c = iterator.next();
602         }
603         return parsed.toString();
604     }
605 
606     /**
607      * Unescapes an escaped character sequence, e.g. \\u00FC.
608      *
609      * @param iterator The string character iterator pointing to the first character after the backslash
610      * @return The unescaped character
611      */
612     private static char parseEscapedSequence(StringCharacterIterator iterator) {
613         char c = iterator.next();
614         if (c == 'b') {
615             return '\b';
616         } else if (c == 'n') {
617             return '\n';
618         } else if (c == 'r') {
619             return '\r';
620         } else if (c == 't') {
621             return '\t';
622         } else if (c == 'U' || c == 'u') {
623             //4 digit hex Unicode value
624             String byte1 = "";
625             byte1 += iterator.next();
626             byte1 += iterator.next();
627             String byte2 = "";
628             byte2 += iterator.next();
629             byte2 += iterator.next();
630             return (char) ((Integer.parseInt(byte1, 16) << 8) + Integer.parseInt(byte2, 16));
631         } else if ((c >= '0') && (c <= '7')) {
632             //3 digit octal ASCII value
633             String num = "";
634             num += c;
635             num += iterator.next();
636             num += iterator.next();
637             return (char) Integer.parseInt(num, 8);
638         } else {
639             // Possibly something that needn't be escaped, but we should accept it
640             // it anyway for consistency with Apple tools.
641             return c;
642         }
643     }
644 
645 }
